article.headline: Arizona State 86, Oregon 75
article.story: EUGENE, Ore. (AP) -- Even with six players, Oregon couldn't stop Ike Diogu and the Arizona State Sun Devils. Diogu had 23 points and 12 rebounds as Arizona State defeated Oregon, 86-75, Saturday before a sold-out crowd at McArthur Court. Jamal Hill had 18 points and Kevin Kruger added 17 for the Sun Devils (10-14 overall, 4-11 Pacific-10 Conference), who hit 14-of-20 free throws in the final 2:09. Serge Angounou had a career-high 12 points for Arizona State. "A win means we're still alive, still better," Arizona State coach Rob Evans said. "To win against a team like Oregon has got to give us confidence." James Davis led Oregon with 18 points, shooting 6-for-15 from 3-point range. Luke Jackson scored 16 points and had 10 assists for the Ducks (12-9, 7-7), who have lost three straight home games for the first time since the 2000-01 season. The Ducks, who are in jeopardy of missing the NCAA tournament for the first time in three seasons, attempted a school-record 38 3-pointers, hitting 14 of them. After erasing a 14-point second-half deficit, Oregon was issued a technical foul for sending six players on the floor with 2:09 left. Hill hit the two ensuing free throws to give Arizona State a 73-64 lead. "ASU wanted it more, and played like there was something at stake," Oregon coach Ernie Kent said. "The bottom line is that (Oregon) was not ready to play. "When you make the mistakes we made down the stretch, it is unacceptable." The Ducks used a 13-3 run to tie the game at 62-62. Freshman Mitch Platt capped the Oregon run with a monstrous one-handed putback dunk after a Jackson miss with 7:14 to play. Diogu put the Sun Devils back on top for good as he converted a three-point play with 5:36 left. Despite a slow start, Arizona State led 42-34 at halftime. Andre Joseph and Jackson hit back-to-back-to-back 3-pointers to give Oregon 9-2 lead. Kevin Kruger hit two 3-pointers in a 15-7 run that gave the Sun Devils their first lead at 17-16. After that, the teams exchanged the lead four times in the first half before the Sun Devils took a 10-point lead on a Jamal Hill 3-pointer with 1:01 left in the half. Oregon hit 6-of-17 3-pointers in the first half.
